SENT.plain: We present a pediatric patient treated with high dose intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG) for acute immune thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP), who developed cerebral sinus thrombosis in the absence of any identifiable hypercoagulable state
This report describes the successful management of this rare complication in this challenging setting
This report shows IVIG induced cerebral sinus thrombosis in ITP
